message: I'm working on a home inventory app where people can input their items along with photos.  I'm 90% there, but I need a way to export the photos if the user chooses to save them later.  For the data, I was able to export the items into a CSV file, but I'm not sure how to handle the photos.

I think Facebook has taken an approach with this that makes the most sense for real-world users by exporting HTML. You could still provide csv as a sensible alternative for people to import their data into another app, but for plan viewing of their information you can't beat static HTML.
I've included an option for the person to print an item with associated photos. I was hoping to offer the ability to export should they choose not to use my service any longer.
@luckytaxi that's what I was getting at. Export a folder with the images and an HTML file displaying the data.
